oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Governor Cooper and training school for military draft registrars, 1940 October 16
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Picture: Governor Prentice Cooper (standing) speaking at the school for training county registrars for the selective service registration and draft boards that Governor Prentice Cooper coordinated in October 1940 at the Tennessee State Capitol in Nashville, Tennessee. William Prentice Cooper, Jr. served as Governor of Tennessee from 1939 to 1945. He led the state’s mobilization efforts for World War II, when over 300,000 Tennesseans joined the armed forces, and several defense-related facilities were established across the state. Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cooper, Prentice, 1895-1969
